segment_text: Stevens rewound the tape, pretending to concentrate on the hum of the machine. "What is it I'm supposed to be hearing?" he asked. "Voices?"
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Across the desk from him, Blair was pale and sweaty. "It's Weston, the other man I was ... traveling with."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Into the future," Stevens said, not bothering to make it a question, no longer believing that Blair would deny it.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "I know what you're thinking. With the tape that way and all. I don't know what happened to it.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: But if you concentrate, you can still hear it. You can hear him saying my name."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Blair's mother sat next to him, her face stiff as papier-mache. How old she looks all of a sudden, Stevens thought. Just since last week.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Here," Blair said. "Let me play it again." He leaned over the desk and pushed PLAY.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: As the weird humming and crackling began again, Stevens let his attention wander to the open window of his office. In the long twilight he could see miles of Kansas prairie rolling away from him, the glint of Fall River in the distance, beyond that the vivid pinks and purples of sunset.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: A warm breeze puffed at the white lace curtains and the smell of cut grass sent his mind back twenty years, to the day he'd first met Blair's mother.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: She'd brought the boy in with chicken pox. Stevens had been drawn to her immediately: strong, thin, handsome, with an educated accent from the Eastern seaboard.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: He'd hoped at first she was widowed or divorced. She hadn't been, of course, so they'd become friends instead, and Stevens had no real regrets.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Though it broke his heart to see her now. She had so much grief locked up inside her, and no way for him to help her with it.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Whatever was wrong with her boy would take a psychiatrist to figure out, maybe a team of them.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Stevens shut off the tape in mid-yowl.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Look," Blair said. "You told me you'd heard of the Project."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Heard of it, yes. I heard there was some kind of space station they were using for time research, or some such nonsense."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "A relay station. In geosynchronous orbit. With matter transporters and a Schwartzchild simulator that can produce nearly infinite acceleration. That's why they had to put it up there in space."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Stevens spread his hands out on the desk. "You've obviously read up on it. I'm not going to debate this with you.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: I don't even know what half those words mean. The simple fact is that they closed the project down five years ago. And you were never part of it."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Stevens pushed the EJECT button and handed Blair the cassette. "Until two days ago you were in California, in graduate school. Your mother has letters to prove it.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Then you suddenly showed up on the train from Wichita, babbling a lot of nonsense about government projects and time machines. There's nothing else I can say."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Blair nodded, looking resigned. "I knew there wasn't any point in coming to you. But Mom insisted."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Go on home. Get some sleep. If you still feel ... disoriented tomorrow, maybe I can prescribe something."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: "Yeah, right," Blair said, getting heavily to his feet.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Stevens wondered if he would ever get used to the sight of the adults he remembered as children. "I'll go wait in the car, Mom."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: When the office door closed, Stevens said, "I'm sorry. I just don't think there's anything I can do."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Tears started in her eyes, then refused to fall. "I know. I just ... couldn't keep it to myself any longer."
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: She stood and reached one hand across the desk to him. Stevens took the hand and held it, but she wouldn't meet his eyes.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, tape recorder, lace curtains, twilight prairie view

segment_text: Blair lay in the darkness of his parents' house and lived through it all again.
scene_description: indoors, dark bedroom, moonlight from window, old wooden closet, flannel bathrobe

segment_text: He and Weston, suiting up in the relay station. Stepping into the transport chamber, the energy field making his hair crackle and his stomach chum.
scene_description: indoors, futuristic relay station, glowing transport chamber, crackling energy field, metallic walkways

segment_text: The feeling of falling, a small impact against the bottoms of his feet. Then his first sight of the future.
scene_description: indoors, futuristic relay station, glowing transport chamber, crackling energy field, metallic walkways

segment_text: They stood on an endless plain of concrete, rough textured, unpainted, broken only by a network of hairline cracks. The sky was clouded over and a relentless wind sent sand and grit pinging against their helmets.
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: "Blair?" Weston said. "Do you feel something ... ?"
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: Blair turned to look at him. Through the distorted glass of the face plate he saw Weston's mouth tighten in pain.
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: Blair was reaching for him when Weston began to scream. Weston's suit seemed to shrivel and contract. In an instant he was gone.
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: Then Blair felt it himself, his entire body flexing and distorting like a reflection in a piece of foil. Something popped in the cooling system of his suit and he was suddenly flooded with freezing air.
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: His stomach heaved. He took one step forward, groping blindly, and then the whole world shot away from him, in all directions. He blacked out.
scene_description: outdoors, endless concrete plain, hairline cracks, overcast sky, wind-swept grit

segment_text: He came to on the floor of the relay station, his skin covered with chill bumps inside the suit, his teeth rat, ding and his arms instinctively wrapped around his legs for warmth that wouldn't come.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: He crawled to the control console and read the instruments. Power but no air, no heat. He was trapped in the malfunctioning suit.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: A red light blinked next to the cassette recorder. Blair reached out with a shaking hand and played the tape through his suit radio.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: "Blair ... I've waited here two hours and I can't see waiting any longer. I don't know what's happened, but the transporter seems to be working. I'm going to try it.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: "Blair ... this is not the station we left from. Something's gone wrong. In this world, the station has been shut down for years.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: If you end up here, use the transporter. I'll try to find you somehow."
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: Blair had the tape in his hand as he staggered down the hall to the transporter. The room was empty.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: He could feel the blast of escaping air when he opened the hatch. Once inside, the room began to repressurize automatically.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: He got out of the freezing suit as soon as there was air to breathe. His clothes weren't in the locker where he'd left them.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: Instead there was a suit of coveralls with someone else's name on the chest. He got into them and checked the transport controls.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: Everything seemed to be functioning. The destination coordinates were set for NASA in Houston.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: He started to power up the machine with a hand that still shook-he wondered if he would ever be warm again-and then hesitated. If Weston was right, and this world wasn't the same one they'd left, he could transport himself into the middle of a concrete wall.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: His mind suddenly flashed on Neodesha, the flat empty land where he'd grown up. It hadn't changed in hundreds of years, and he remembered the latitude and longitude from his school days.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: He reset the coordinates, and as he pushed the TRANSMIT button he was thinking of home.
scene_description: indoors, dark relay station, malfunctioning console, blinking red light, frost-covered surfaces

segment_text: His mind skipped over the rest: the lurch of the transporter, falling into the field outside of town, catching a ride on the Wichita train. He concentrated on the earthly, visible reality in front of him, the cool breeze coming in the window, the sound of crickets and wind.
scene_description: indoors, dark bedroom, moonlight from window, old wooden closet, flannel bathrobe

segment_text: It's all right, he thought. I'm back. I'm safe.
scene_description: indoors, dark bedroom, moonlight from window, old wooden closet, flannel bathrobe

segment_text: It's 1990 and this is Kansas, and I'm back again.
scene_description: indoors, dark bedroom, moonlight from window, old wooden closet, flannel bathrobe

segment_text: He found his old red and gray flannel bathrobe in the closet and put it on, hugging it against himself for warmth. He didn't want to go back to sleep, didn't want to let the fragile illusion of reality slip away.
scene_description: indoors, dark bedroom, moonlight from window, old wooden closet, flannel bathrobe

segment_text: He walked barefoot into the living room, stepping around the loose board that had creaked all his life. He sat on the blue floral sofa with his legs tucked under him, wanting a cup of coffee but unwilling to risk waking his father, who still got up at six every morning for his job at the lumber yard.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: He remembered the awkward silence when he'd tried to talk to his father about the project, the haunted look in his mother's eyes.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: He picked up the newspaper from the coffee table and glanced at it by the moonlight coming in through the front window. The small town trivia of retirements and flower shows was comforting, had him on the verge of sleep.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Then he noticed the date at the top of the page. April 23. 1997.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: He clutched his stomach to keep from screaming.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Through the window he could see the spindly heads of the rye grass in the uncut lawn, the asphalt street, the lightning-split oak in the neighbor's yard. He'd grown up with that sight, but now it was terrifyingly alien.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: When the voice spoke his name, he nearly jumped out of his skin. "Blair..."
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: He turned to see Weston in the doorway. "Had to warn you," Weston said.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: He was dressed in jeans and a sport shirt, reaching out with one hand. "It's not holding ... I wound up back on the station again ... couldn't tell if it was the same one or not ... used the transporter again but something's wrong..."
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Weston reached for the wall and his hand passed through the paneling. "I don't know how much longer I've got. Listen, Blair, you have to..."
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Clear streaks of lightning shot through Weston's image. His voice turned to static. In a second he was gone.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Blair was left with the memory of his face, distorted in unbearable pain. Blair ran to the spot where Weston had stood.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: Nothing remained, no smell of ozone, no stains on the wooden floor, nothing to show it had been anything but a dream.
scene_description: indoors, moonlit living room, floral sofa, coffee table with newspaper, creaking floorboard

segment_text: The morning came up sunny, with a slight chill that had burned off by the time the coffee was done.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door

segment_text: She hadn't wanted to wake her son yet, but he'd always been a light sleeper. He couldn't possibly have slept through the noise she'd already made.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door

segment_text: She put sugar in a cup of coffee and took it to his room. She stopped outside his door.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door

segment_text: A wave of feeling, of loss, came over her for no reason. She had to swallow, hard, and brush her hair back to regain control.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door

segment_text: Then she knocked softly with one knuckle and eased the door open. It was as if she'd known he would be gone.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door

segment_text: She sat on the rumpled bed, touching the cool sheets, and let silent tears run down her face.
scene_description: indoors, sunlit bedroom, rumpled empty bed, cool sheets, open door
